answers.answer: Hi Meme,I don’t think nerve roots could be the problem for your tingling in arms and feet. Any type of tingling, burning, severe pain, or numbness is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured. The nerve involved appears to be originating from Cervical and Lower Lumbar Vertebrae. Arm sensation from shoulder suggests disruption of nerve supply from group of nerves called Brachial Plexus and leg sensation appears to originate from Sciatic nerve.This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae.I think you should consult a physician to evaluate your case.If required MRI scan can be done.Alternatively you can start taking Multivitamin supplements.Bye.

question: I had a spinal tap performed aproximately 2 months ago. Since then I have been experiencing various symptoms such as tingling in the lower back and bowel region, urethral buring sensations, nausea, vertigo (which all have subsided), now I have intermitten tingling in arms and feet, trouble concentrating at times, jolts in my head,  Could nerve damage be the root to my problems.
title: spinal tap
